components.description:
A hand with the index finger pointing straight forward at the person viewing the emoji. Used to represent the word and concept of 'you,' the second-person singular and plural pronoun.

This symbol is seen in art, advertisements, and military recruitment posters as a way to draw the viewer into the image they're looking at.

This hand shape is also used in multiple sign languages from around the world.
components.title: Index Pointing at the Viewer

title: Index Pointing at the Viewer

version.description:
Unicode 14.0 is the version of the Unicode Standard released on September 14, 2021. 37 new emoji code points were added in this release, with all 112 new emojis (including sequences for skin tones) listed under Emoji 14.0.

New emojis added in this release are update expected to come to major platforms in either late 2021 or early 2022.

This release of this Unicode Standard was delayed from March 2021 due to COVID-19. 

  • üìù Unicode 14.0 details on Unicode.org
